Fields.DialogueText: Laying out in the storm again, huh?
I'm still cooling down.
I've felt like I've been on fire since our little trip to the Mediterranean.

Fields.MenuText: I really am sorry. I mean, it needed to be done, but I wish I'd found a way to make it easier on you.
It wasn't that hot. You make it sound like we visited the gates of the underworld or something.
On fire? Are you sure you don't have a fever?

Fields.DialogueText: *sigh* I guess I forgive you. I guess.
Well, it wasn't as hot as that, but it was this close.
If I am sick, then it's your fault. So you should feel horrible about yourself right now.
Well... you're more than welcome to join me up here. If you're not afraid to get a little wet.
Actually... I think I'll take you up on that.
Captain, we're getting reports of Morganas just off the coast. They seem to be headed this way.
It looks like we'll have to put a pin in that, Salmon.
Next time. I'll remember, For now, we've got some Morganas to tend to.
@BATTLE
Ah, forgiveness feels good - and actually, so does this rain.
At least that's in the past now. Presently, you get to enjoy some refreshingly cool rain.
Oh, believe me, I do. Is there any way I can maybe make it up to you?
Captain, if you're not busy, I was hoping we could have a conversation.
You know what, a conversation sounds nice right about now. Come in.
Have you ever been in love?
Well, that's... abrupt and personal.
I'm sorry, did you want me to make small talk first?
That's usually how conversations go.
Please, Captain, just answer the question.

Fields.MenuText: I've been in love before. It's one of the best feelings in the world. If you're lucky.
I don't think I've been in love before. I love lots of things, but I've never been in love with anything.
Yeah. I've been in love... all I have to say on the matter is that it was a mistake. A horrendous mistake.

Fields.DialogueText: I see, it was that impactful of an emotion for you.
I guess that makes sense. It can be a rare emotion.
A mistake? Really? First time I've heard that.
What about you?
What about me?
Do you have a love life? Love isn't out of your repertoire, is it?
So... you want to know if I'm in love with someone?
I get the feeling you don't want to tell me.
No, it's...
*ALARM*
It's fine, Salmon. The Morganas don't want you to talk about it either. Let's go take care of them.
As long as we can continue our conversation later.
I'm not going anywhere.
Unless these Morganas take care of us here and now.
That would not be good.
@BATTLE
Captain, I have something to report.
What, did you just get out of the water? Dry yourself off already.
Did I mention it's urgent?
Okay, I'm listening. What's going on?
So, I was swimming alongside the submarine when I caught view of a school of fish.
I watched them for a while until they swam too far off, but before I turned my head, I saw, in the distance, a pair of Morganas sailing away from us.
Away? What's so urgent then? They're not about to attack us.
No, but I think we should follow them.
You want us to ambush a couple of Morganas? That's still not my idea of urgent.
What I'm saying is that we should follow them to wherever they're headed. If I'm right, they'll lead us to a few of their friends.
Okay, I think I'm seeing it now.

Fields.MenuText: You think if we follow them we can ambush an entire gang of them?
You want us to waste our time for a couple Morganas?
This is a surprise party situation going on here, right?

Fields.DialogueText: Exactly, and if we don't start after them soon, we'll lose them.
It's not a waste. Who knows how many Morganas they could lead us to?
A surprise party? This is a war, not a birthday. Don't be an idiot.
Okay, if you think the smart move is to follow them, then I'll follow your lead.
Thank you. Captain. Let's go to it!
@BATTLE
Salmon?
You in here? I brought you lunch.
You brought me lunch? Why would you do that?

Fields.MenuText: I... was thinking about you... thought you might be hungry.
I didn't see you in the mess hall. I was just trying to be friendly.
The only thing I've seen you eat are hazelnuts. You can't blame me for being a little worried about your diet.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, well, thank you, Captain. It's a lovely gesture.
Do you often look for me in the mess hall, Captain? Curious.
My diet is perfectly fine, thank you very much. No need for you to worry.
You actually have very fortunate timing. I was just beginning to get a little peckish.
Well, here you go. I got you extra servings, so you shouldn't be hungry afterwards.
You're not kidding. There's enough on this plate for two people. Maybe even three.
I wasn't sure what you liked, so I might've gone a little overboard and grabbed some of everything.
That was... very smart.
That's quite a compliment coming from you.
You know... if you're not busy, you could help me devour this mountain of food.
*ALARM*
I'm sorry, what? I couldn't hear you over the alarm.
I said all this food will have to wait until we beat these Morganas.
Right, let's go to it.
@BATTLE
Is Salmon still outside swimming?
I think so. I haven't seen her come back in.
It's been longer than usual. Are we sure she's all right?
Well it's not like a shark could've eaten her... right?
Salmon! Get back in here!
If you're not in a shark's belly.
Even if she was eaten by a shark, couldn't she just phase through it like she does with the ship?
I don't know. I've never tried. It'd be an interesting experiment, though.

Fields.MenuText: Having fun out there, Salmon?
You were starting to worry me. You're not hurt, are you?
Please don't get eaten by a shark for science.

Fields.DialogueText: Tons. I made a new friend out there, actually.
I'm fine, no sharks or anything. I just got a little distracted and lost track of time.
It was a joke, Captain. Dangerous experiments like that aren't exactly my cup of tea.
I know I've been out for a while, but this cute little fish has been swimming alongside me and he's so cute. I could watch him all day.
You want to go back out and swim with him some more, don't you?
... How'd you know?
You literally have one foot out the door.
*shrugs*
Have fun. Just keep an ear out for Morganas.
Thanks, Captain.
Well, at least she's...
Eeeek, he's still out there! So cute!
... happy.
Heh.
Captain, do you have some time?
Well, you're not dripping wet, so I'll assume this doesn't have to do with Morganas.
Nope - not yet, at least. You never know when they could pop up.
Are you here to ask more personal questions?
Maybe.
In that case...

Fields.MenuText: Sit down. I'm an open book for you.
Maybe some other time? I'm not in the best mood.
Only if you go first.

Fields.DialogueText: An open book? So I could ask you anything?
Is something the matter? Did something happen?
You want to ask me a question? I guess it's only fair. Go ahead.
I... trust you more than anyone, Captain... I really do.
Good. That's the first step to any successful partnership.
Partnership?
I'm clearly not running this ship alone. You're the brains behind the operation.
That... I... I don't know what to say.
You don't have much time to say anything. It sounds like we've got Morganas knocking at our doors.
Go to it, then! We'll make them regret it.
@BATTLE
Sure. I can't think of anything you could ask that I wouldn't want to tell you.
You really have that much trust in me?
I do. Do you trust me?
No, it's just... I've been thinking a lot lately.
About?
About you and me. I just... it just feels like there's a barrier between us. Like there's not enough trust there.
That easy? I was expecting some resistance.
... I know it might not seem like it sometimes... but I do want you to get to know me better.
What would make it easier for you, Salmon? What would help you trust me?
Man, why did we have to make port here?
I thought you loved it here. You were talking about how beautiful the rolling hills were.
Well they are. And here I am, only able to stare at them from a distance.
If you want, you can go back inside while we're here. We won't be much longer.
No, I want to enjoy it as long as I can. It's bittersweet, but it's better than nothing.
If you're sure, I'll let you know when we're heading out.
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: Oh, I see. That really isn't fair, is it?
Don't get greedy. At least you're not in the Mediterranean again.
Maybe one day you'll get to walk on those hills.

Fields.DialogueText: Yeah, but it could be worse.
You're right. That would be worse. Thanks, Captain.
Maybe. But for now I'm stuck admiring them from afar.
*KNOCK*
Come in, Captain.
Hey. You weren't in the mess hall again. I brought you some food.
I told you you didn't have to do this, didn't I?

Fields.MenuText: I care about you. So I'm going to make sure you're fed whether you want me to or not.
I'm your captain, and I have certain responsibilities. And if I need to, I'll order you to stay fed.
We both know you're hungry.

Fields.DialogueText: You care? Well, thanks, I was starting to get a little hungry.
Really? You're going to pull rank now? Fine. I was starting to get hungry.
Don't pretend like you know me. If I were hungry, I'd say I was hungry.
Here's your food. You know, if you started coming down to the mess hall, we could just eat together. I wouldn't have to be your meal deliverer.
Is this your version of a guilt trip?
It might be.
You just don't want to keep bringing me plates of food, huh?
No, I'm fine with it. But I know the crew would love to see more of their Belle.
How noble of you. I'll think about joining you next time. I promise.
Good. I look forward to seeing you there.
*ALARM*
I guess I better eat fast.
Not too fast, we don't want you cramping up on the battlefield.
@BATTLE
*stomach growl*
... I'm hungry. Now. Now I'm hungry.
Salmon's still in the water, isn't she?
Yeah, but she checked in. She said that her fish friend was back.
That's great, but I need to talk to her. It's kind of important.
Salmon!
You rang, Captain?

Fields.MenuText: You look chipper.
It still creeps me out when just stick your head through the hull like that.
Having fun?

Fields.DialogueText: Do I? I've been having fun teaching Adam some new tricks.
Sorry, but I'm worried that Adam will swim away if I come all the way in.
Yeah, Adam's been keeping me company out here.
Adam?
The fish that's been following us. I taught him how to backflip. It's the cutest thing.
I'm really glad you're in a good mood, because uh...
Hold on a second... yeah, I'm sensing a few Morganas headed straight for us.
Well, you heard her, it's time to get ready. Sound the alarm.
*ALARM*
Did you have something to tell me?
It can wait.
If you say so. I'll be right back.
Where are you going?
I have to shoo Adam to safety.
@BATTLE
Captain, you said you said you wanted to talk?
Yes, I did. Sit down.
Is something going on? Something serious?
No, nothing serious. I just figured that it was about time we continue our conversation.
Really? Usually I'm the one asking to talk.

Fields.MenuText: I got impatient.
I like to turn things on their head sometimes.
If you want, you can ask now. I'll wait.

Fields.DialogueText: You don't like to wait for things, huh?
So I should expect the unexpected from you?
I'm not that petty, Captain. I don't have to lead the conversation all the time.
*ALARM*
How do Morganas know to attack every time we start talking?
One of these days, we're going to be able to have a nice, long, uninterrupted conversation.
Yeah, just as soon as we defeat all the Morganas.
That'll be the day.
@BATTLE
If you're waiting for something, you're doing it wrong.
Some things are worth waiting for. Like victory. You can't rush into battle and expect to win the war.
If you were expecting the unexpected, wouldn't that make the unexpected expected?
I think you might be overthinking it. But it's cute when you furrow your brow in thought like that.
Glad to hear it. I like the sound of your voice, but I like mine more.
That might've been the most self-absorbed compliment I've ever heard.
Captain, we got a message for you.
From?
Your contacts in Italy. It's urgent.
Thank you. I'll read it immediately.
... Are you just going to stand there while I read it?
I can wait.
Okay...
Oh, this isn't good. They want us to return to the Mediterranean.
Why, didn't we finish the job?
I don't think anyone knows how to finish this particular job. But, yeah, Delusion's back with a new group, and they've started raiding cities along the North African coast. Causing havoc.
What are we going to do?

Fields.MenuText: There's a fair chance that this is retaliation for what we did before. But...
Ugh. How am I going to tell Salmon?
A lot of people are dying...

Fields.DialogueText: There's no proof that we caused this. It could be different Morganas, for all we know.
You did promise her you wouldn't go back there.
The Morganas are causing pain all over the world. The Mediterranean isn't the only place with lives being lost.
You make a good point.
Okay, we stick with our current priorities for now, we divert what resources we can from the North Sea to help in the Mediterranean. Hopefully that'll be enough.
Captain, I'm sensing Morganas... oh, am I interrupting something?
Nothing as important as getting ready for battle. Sound the alarms.
Yes, Captain.
@BATTLE
Captain, I have a very serious matter to discuss with you.
What is it?
I normally wouldn't bring it up, but I feel like we've bonded now, and I feel safe enough to talk to you about this.
I get it, Salmon, what's going on?
It might not be that big of a deal to some people, but it's very important to my process. But I'm not addicted. Don't even get me started on...
Salmon!

Fields.MenuText: You had me at serious matter.
You stopped making sense a while ago.
You're wasting both of our time now.

Fields.DialogueText: Really? Uh, sorry about that. I'm just a little nervous.
I always make sense. You just weren't paying attention.
Sorry, I'm nervous. Let me start again.
Just tell me what's wrong.
... I'm out of hazelnuts.
... That's it?
Yes... if it's not too much trouble... I'd appreciate it if we could make for port. I need to stock up.
We're still pretty good on supplies... but I can't say no to those puppy dog eyes.
Thank you, Captain. You're a life-saver. Truly.
You can thank me later. For now let's fight some Morganas. Then we'll make port.
Sounds like a plan, Captain!
@BATTLE
Why are you smiling like that?
I'm just happy you're finally eating in the mess hall. And not just hazelnuts.
So? It's not that big a deal. I was hungry.

Fields.MenuText: Usually you'd just wait until I brought you some food.
It's a big deal for me. I don't have to worry about deliveries after I eat now.
No hazelnuts to snack on, right?

Fields.DialogueText: Well, I'm hungrier than usual. I don't have anything to snack on.
Was I really that much of a burden on you? I really didn't mean to be.
Exactly. I feel empty, right now.
Well, whatever reason you're here, I'm glad you're joining me.
Me too. It's nice... actually eating a meal together. Maybe I'll make a habit of it.
I hope you do. I'll always have a seat open for you if you decide you want it.
Thanks, that means a lot, Captain.
*ALARM*
Figures.
Whoa, this place gets crazy when the alarm goes off.
Everyone's hurrying to battle positions. It's a good kind of crazy. You should probably just keep your head down for a second.
Yeah, I already picked up on that.
@BATTLE
Okay, you sit. Relax. Eat. I'm going to go get you your nuts - just give me a few minutes.
Is there anything else I can pick up for you?
Get me more hazelnuts and you'll be my hero.

Fields.MenuText: Hero? As long as I don't have to wear a cape and tights.
The hero business has never really been for me, but I'll do it anyway.
You make it sound like I'm saving you from a burning building.

Fields.DialogueText: I don't know... I think you could pull that look off.
And that's what makes you a real hero.
Trust me, you're doing even more than that.
Okay, I'll be right back.
Salmon, have you seen the Captain?
Just left. Can I help you with anything?
We just got another message from the Captain's contacts in Italy. I'm here to deliver it.
You can give it to me. I'll make sure it's delivered.
Okay, I'll leave it to you.
Hmmm... it wouldn't be too nosy to take just a little peek, would it?
No, of course not!
... What? The Captain didn't tell me about this. What do I do about this?
Wait, they're back again? Didn't we finish them?
I think this is a group from further north - not that it matters. Let's just deal with it quickly.
If only so they'll shut the klaxons off. Agreed.
@BATTLE
Salmon... why are you sitting in my chair?
I have a better question.
Why are you keeping secrets from me?

Fields.MenuText: Secrets?
Before I get myself in trouble, what secrets are you talking about?
I'm not keeping anything from you, Salmon.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, to be accurate, one, particular secret.
You have more?! How big of a liar are you?
Oh, really? This message begs to differ.
I'm talking about this. Why didn't you tell me the Mediterranean was being raided by Morganas?
According to this, your contacts think we're the ones who angered them into attacking.
That's not a secret. Morganas are attacking everywhere, and we have to prioritize our targets.
Besides, I promised you you wouldn't have to go back. That's one of the advantages of having other ships to call on.
Lives are being lost, Captain.
Lives are being lost everywhere.
We're going to help them.
You want to go back to the Mediterranean? You?
I didn't say that. But I do have a plan.
I'd love to hear it.
*ALARM*
I'll tell you all about it after we deal with a couple Morganas.
@BATTLE
Message?
And that's it.
That's the plan.
Did you get all of it, or do I need to go over some of the finer points again?

Fields.MenuText: You were talking? I'm sorry, I zoned out there.
I got it. You basically want to lure this Morgana flotilla all the way to the north Pacific, right?
I understand it. I just don't agree with it.

Fields.DialogueText: Captain, seriously? In summary, I want to draw the Morgana fleet out of the Mediterranean and back into the Pacific.
Exactly. I'm glad you paid attention.
What? Is there something wrong with it?
We need to bring them to the Pacific. If we defeat them in the Mediterranean again, they'll just come back and strike it twice as hard.
I'm hoping that this way, if they come back, they'll stay nice and close to the Arctic Circle.
I see. And are you going this far to help the people the Morganas are attacking in Italy, or to keep yourself out of hot water?
Can't it be for both?
Normally? No. But since it's you, I could see it happening.
I'm glad you have that much faith in me, Captain.
*ALARM*
I guess this meeting is over.
Glad to see that the Morganas let us finish talking for once.
@BATTLE
Sure. But why?
I'm just curious why. Wouldn't it be easier to just fight them there?
It seems a little convoluted. Especially when we could just fight them where they are.
Captain, I can't find Adam. He's usually right outside waiting for me, but I looked all over and he's nowhere to be found.
Isn't that a good thing? We're about to start a fight with a sizeable group of Morganas. You wouldn't want him getting hurt, would you?
You're right. I just can't help but be worried.

Fields.MenuText: I promise we can look for him when the battle is over.
Get over it. We need your head in the game, Salmon.
Maybe he's a turncoat. He probably joined the Morganas and is on his way to fight us right now.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm going to hold you to that, Captain. This is important to me.
You're right. I'm sorry, My crew needs me right now. I'll worry about him later. I'm sure he's all right.
Don't even joke about that, Captain! That would be absolutely horrible!
*ALARM*
Huh. We're not in position yet, are we?
No, it's probably just a few Morganas that got a little too curious.
Then let's take care of them quick. They'll be a good appetizer before the main course.
@BATTLE
Okay, we're here.
What's next, Salmon?
Now, we surface.

Fields.MenuText: Surface? Isn't that a bit counterproductive?
Okay, let's do it!
We're not going to surface. We're in a submarine. Are you crazy?

Fields.DialogueText: How else are we going to draw attention to ourselves?
I'm glad you're completely on board, Captain.
No, I'm not crazy. It's just the only way to lure out the Morganas.
We're going to surface and then slowly drift into the range of the raiding Morganas - if they're the ones we fought before, I'm sure they'll be interested.
Then we'll hightail it out of there before they blow us up and before I get too hot.
As long as you're sure this is the best plan, I'm with you.
I appreciate it, Captain, but I'm afraid there might be a snag in my plan.
What's wrong?
I'm sensing a few Morganas nearby. We should take care of them before we surface.
Nothing more than a speed bump. Let's go!
@BATTLE
I forgot how hot it was here.
We had to go through the Indian Ocean and the Red Sea to get here, you know. It seems odd that the Mediterranean would be so uniquely uncomfortable.
If you want to go out and swim in each of those bodies of water for a week and get back to me, we can compare notes.

Fields.MenuText: Do you want me to get you some ice or something?
You can handle it, Salmon. You're a big girl.
If you're going to be such a baby about it, you can leave. I'm sure I can take care of a few Morganas without you.

Fields.DialogueText: Actually, some ice would be lovely. You're very thoughtful, Captain.
It's too hot... to come up with a response...
Hey! I'm not a baby! I'll be fine, just give me a minute to get used to it.
*ALARM*
Is that the alarm, or is my head ringing again?
No, that's the alarm. Has your head been ringing?
Kind of... It's not important, let's just go to it and take care of these Morganas. This alarm is giving me a splitting headache.
@BATTLE
Captain? Salmon?
The raiding party are coming within range. We're in full view.
What do you think we should do, Captain?

Fields.MenuText: Fire a volley at them, get their attention.
Steady, they'll notice us soon enough.
We should approach a little closer. The sooner they notice us, the better.

Fields.DialogueText: Are you sure we want to anger them any more than we have to?
Seems like a smart move. We don't want to get too close to them.
All right, but we should be careful. We want to hold off on heavy engagements while we're still in Mediterranean waters.
Captain, they've noticed us. If we don't start descending soon, they'll catch us with our pants down.
Then descend!
You heard her! Move, everyone!
If we're forced to limp to a port in this witches' brew, I will not be happy with any of you!
I hope you all can recognize a threat when you hear one.
@BATTLE
We did it! The Morganas are retreating out into the Red Sea!
It's a start.
Not without beating up the submarine a bit. We're going to need to make some repairs. And fast.
As long as it's Port Sudan, I'm ecstatic.
Smell that Indian Ocean air.
A moment's reprieve after a job well done is such a weight off one's shoulders.
Laying out in the middle of a storm can't hurt either, huh?
I don't see you complaining about it. The rain feels great, doesn't it?

Fields.MenuText: I have to admit, I never thought rain could feel this wonderful. It's like the tension is dripping off my body.
It's okay, I guess. I'm mostly here for the company.
It's way too wet out here. Please let me leave already, Salmon.

Fields.DialogueText: Riiiight? It's the best feeling in the world. And don't you just love that smell of fresh rain in the air?
You mean me? Are you trying to flatter me, Captain?
I'm not keeping you out here, Captain. You can leave right now if you want to so badly.
Uh oh...
What's wrong?
There are Morganas headed this way. I hope we're ready for a fight.
We've been ready to leave for a while. You just refused to come inside until the storm passed.
Well, I'm going inside now. Go to it, Captain!
@BATTLE
They call that... petrichor, don't they?
Do they? I like the sound of that. Petrichor.
I'm just doing all I can to stay on your good side is all. I really prefer it there.
Well, I don't think you have to worry about that. You always wind up there in the end.
Really? In that case I'll see you inside. Enjoy your muggy rain.
It's not muggy! It's wonderful!
*ALARM*
Okay, people! We need to keep the Morganas on the line if we're going to get them north of Japan!
Salmon! Salmon, where are you?!
Um, I think I saw her head outside a while back. I'm pretty sure I heard her say something about Adam.

Fields.MenuText: Her stupid fish again? He must still be missing.
She probably went to look for him. I hope he's okay.
Who's Adam again?

Fields.DialogueText: He's not stupid. The opposite is true, in fact.
I appreciate the concern, Captain. You'll be happy to learn that he's doing fine.
You've already forgotten, Captain? He's my fish friend, remember?
I was going to spend the day looking for him outside, but as soon as I stepped out of the submarine, he was there waiting for me.
I was so excited that I've just been spending the day teaching him new tricks.
I bet that's really cute and all, Salmon, but we've kind of got an alarm going off in here.
What? Oh, I had no idea. I guess I was a little distracted.
You think? Just get in here.
Yes, Captain. I'll only be a moment.
Wait, where is she going?
She's shooing Adam away. She'll be right back, just prepare for battle!
@BATTLE
Would you look at that? I think we were actually able to have a conversation without the Morganas rudely interrupting.
Is that your way of saying you don't want to talk anymore?
No, not at all. There's nowhere I'd rather be.

Fields.MenuText: Not even with Adam?
Me neither. Well, maybe I could stand to be a little closer to you.
Honestly, I'd really love to be on a beach somewhere relaxing, maybe getting a tan.

Fields.DialogueText: Hmmm, it's close, but I think you come out ahead. But only barely.
Heh, Captain, I think you might've had a little too much of this to drink.
As long as that beach is in the middle of a storm, you can count me in.
What's that?
Why did it take two bottles of wine to get you to finally talk about yourself a little bit?
Honestly? It probably would've only taken one.
Seriously. Why don't you like talking about yourself?
You really want to know?
*nod*
I guess it's because humans are more interesting than I am.
I mean, I know I'm a Belle and everything, and you all think that's impressive or whatever, but for me, humanity is simply fascinating.
I've only been able to walk and talk and breathe like this for so long, while the rest of you take it for granted every day.
I want to know everything there is to know about life and the people who live it, because... well, because I hope to be living it with you from now on.
When you open up, you really open up.
Sorry, was that too much?
No, never apologize for telling me something. I'm just... happy.
And I've got to say, I think you're a very interesting person. And not just because you're a Belle.
Then why?
*ALARM*
There's that alarm.
Well, it took them longer than normal.
Not long enough, if you ask me.
@BATTLE
Glad to hear I don't have any serious competition.
I wouldn't say that. I am quite a prize. I'm sure I have plenty of suitors who would be willing to compete for my affections.
Before you start making me jealous, I was hoping I could ask you a question.
I'll just pack an umbrella. That way we both win.
You're excellent at compromise, you know that, Captain?
I hear that a lot, but you know what I'd really like to hear?
I could blame it on the alcohol. But, it's not that hard to believe I'm just being honest, is it?
Are you trying to tell me something, Captain?
Maybe I am. And maybe I'll tell you if you tell me something first.
Captain? Are you in here?
The evidence seems to suggest it.
Captain, are you okay? You look unwell.

Fields.MenuText: I feel perfectly fine. A little hungry, I suppose.
Could you maybe turn the Northern Lights down a little bit? The glare is killing me.
I probably just drank a little too much. I'll be fine, though.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, good. I know it was kind of a late night. And loud.
I understand. You're a bit of a lightweight, aren't you? Do you even remember what we talked about at all?
I'm glad to hear it. Though maybe next time we'll only drink the one bottle of wine.
Oh, before I forget: I want to talk to you later. It's important.
Well, I'm here now.
I still need a little time to gather my thoughts. Sorry.
It's okay. I'll just go for a swim while I wait.
*ALARM*
Sounds like you won't have any time for swimming.
No, I'm sure I will. These fools won't last too long.
@BATTLE
Trust me, I've survived worse.
Of course I remember... I just can't think right now is all.
I'm just glad to hear I'm not the only one hoping for a next time.
Salmon, do you have a minute?
I was hoping to get some swimming in. You could join me!
I'm a little bit less resistant to hypothermia than you are. Sorry.
Listen, I've been talking to some of our welders and some of our engineers, and I think we can offer you... well, a present.
It would take a couple of supply runs to get the glass and whatnot, but we think we can arrange for an aquarium space.
I'm sorry?
For Adam. And for any other friends you've made out there.
I know you're particular to northern waters, and I know it's a hardship to leave pets... if that's even the word... behind whenever duty calls.

Fields.MenuText: So, we all thought it might help to take some of it with you when you go.
And, honestly, I figure if bringing some fish along will make you happier, we all win.
Plus, if anybody ever wants fresh fish...

Fields.DialogueText: "We all," huh?
That seems a bit disrespectful, but it's probably not wrong.
Don't even joke!
And, obviously, you could let them back out into the ocean whenever. If you think they need to swim free, that's... what's so funny?
Nothing! It's just... you've really been putting a lot of thought into how I feel about fish, haven't you?
It's all I ever think about.
Okay, no.
But I want to do something that makes you happy, and... well, hazelnuts notwithstanding, I've been hard-pressed to think of anything you really like.
Look in the mirror sometime.
Actually, I.... That is to say, you...
Salmon?
*ALARM*
Oh, time to fight! Let's go!
Um...
And the aquarium is a lovely idea! Thank you!
Okay, then.
@BATTLE
"Look in the mirror sometime." Oh, GOD. Why hasn't one of the Belles who actually knows how to flirt put out a handbook for-
Salmon? Ma'am? I have a shipment of-
I didn't say anything! You didn't hear anything! Gotta go!
*SPLASH*
... More hazelnuts for me, I guess!
